byline.original: By HAROLD CALLENDER By Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: hopes of escaping war involvement increase
snippet: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, May 2-- In Sweden tonight there was amazement at what was regarded as the severe defeat of the Allies in Norway, and at what many called the weakness and hesitation that had caused it....

headline.main: SWEDEN IMPERILED BY ALLIED RETREAT; Isolation Enlarges Chance of Nazi Domination--Some Bitterness Expressed CAMPAIGN IS CRITICIZED Norwegians Seem to Feel That Something Less Than Full Effort Was Expended

lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, May 2-- In Sweden tonight there was amazement at what was regarded as the severe defeat of the Allies in Norway, and at what many called the weakness and hesitation that had caused it.
